comment: Configuration for running an App in a VM

variables.name: extraIdsigs
variables.comment: Idsigs for the extra APKs. Must match with the extra_apks in the payload config.

variables.name: encryptedStorageImage
variables.comment:
* This backs the persistent, encrypted storage in vm.
   * It also comes with some integrity guarantees.
   * Note: Storage is an optional feature

variables.name: payload
variables.comment: Detailed configuration for the VM, specifying how the payload will be run.

variables.name: osName
variables.comment:
* Name of the OS to run the payload. Currently "microdroid" and * "microdroid_gki-android14-6.1" is supported. * *

Setting this field to a value other than "microdroid" requires * android.permission.USE_CUSTOM_VIRTUAL_MACHINE

variables.name: protectedVm
variables.comment: Whether the VM should be a protected VM.

variables.name: memoryMib
variables.comment:
* The amount of RAM to give the VM, in MiB. If this is 0 or negative then it will default to
   * the value in microdroid.json, if any, or the crosvm default.

variables.name: cpuTopology
variables.comment: The vCPU topology that will be generated for the VM. Default to 1 vCPU.

variables.name: hugePages
variables.comment:
*  Ask the kernel for transparent huge-pages (THP). This is only a hint and
   *  the kernel will allocate THP-backed memory only if globally enabled by
   *  the system and if any can be found. See
   *  https://docs.kernel.org/admin-guide/mm/transhuge.html
